Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Preface Who This Review Is For

Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Tony Hirst Last generated on 16 October, 2021 Preface Automatically generated stage timing and results for stages on WRC RallyRACC Rally de España, 2021. Based on analysis of timing and results data downloaded from the WRC website. To discuss / critique / comment on these analyses, please use the discussion forum. For a guide to the code used to generate the stage reports, see Visualising WRC Rally Results. See also Visualising WRC Rally Stages. This report is unofficial and is not associated in any way with the Fédération Internationale de l’Automobile (FIA) or WRC Promoter GmbH. Who This Review Is For The RallyDataJunkie project, such as it is, is a personal exploration of various ways of representing and visualising rally related stage, timing and results data. There are several potential audiences: rally fans, looking for summaries of rally events; teams and crews, looking for variously arranged summaries to check and compare performances; commentators and journalists, looking for variously arranged summaries and overviews as a tool for confirming or identifying storypoints; data folk, looking for various ways of representing various route, timing or results data.

Note that the stage position is based on the positions given by WRC Live Timing. If two drivers record the same time (or at least, same time to a tenth of a second), only one of them will have position==1 and the other will be position==2. the stage winner. 1.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 1.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times stage and picked up twenty-four thousand and five places to take the overall lead of the rally recording a time of 616.9s. NEU took second place on stage, 5.1s behind EVA in a time of 622.0s and moved up twenty-four thousand and five places to second overall. OGI was in third place on stage, with a time of 625.0s and moved up twenty-four thousand and two places to third overall. SOR was in fifth position on stage, with a time of 626.1s and moved up twenty-four thousand and seven places to fifth overall and just 0.2s further behind OGI. ROV took sixth position on stage, with a time of 627.3s and moved up twenty-four thousand and two places to sixth overall. FOU took seventh position on stage, 21.2s behind EVA in a time of 638.1s and moved up twenty-four thousand and six places to seventh overall. SLN was in eighth place on stage, 26.2s behind stage winner EVA and moved up twenty-four thousand and six places to eighth overall. GRE was in ninth on stage, 29.0s behind EVA in a time of 645.9s and moved up twenty-four thousand and two places to ninth overall. SOL took tenth place on stage, with a time of 649.4s and moved up twenty-four thousand and five places to tenth overall. 1.3 Driver Report, SS1 - OGI OGI was in third place on stage, with a time of 625.0s and moved up twenty-four thousand and two places to third overall. comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 2.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 4.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 5.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 7.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 8.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times FOU took second on stage, with a time of 631.3s . SOR was in third place on stage, 2.8s behind stage winner NEU in a time of 632.4s . OGI was in fourth on stage, 2.9s behind stage winner NEU, just 0.1s off SOR. EVA took fifth place on stage, 1.4s behind OGI . ROV took sixth on stage, 1.6s behind EVA . SOL took seventh place on stage, with a time of 642.9s . GRE was in eighth on stage, 13.5s behind NEU in a time of 643.1s, just 0.2s off SOL. SLN took ninth position on stage, 17.5s behind NEU . KAT was in tenth on stage, with a time of 647.8s and moved up one place to tenth overall, just 0.7s further back behind SLN. 8.3 Driver Report, SS8 - OGI OGI was in fourth on stage, 2.9s behind stage winner NEU, just 0.1s off SOR.
